verses.verse: Open <S%H6605><s%> your doors, <S%H1817><s%> O Lebanon, <S%H3844><s%> That a fire <S%H784><s%> may feed <S%H398><s%> on your cedars. <S%H730><s%>

Wail, <S%H3213><s%> O cypress, <S%H1265><s%> for the cedar <S%H730><s%> has fallen, <S%H5307><s%> Because <S%H834><s%> the glorious <S%H117><s%> [trees] have been destroyed; <S%H7703><s%> Wail, <S%H3213><s%> O oaks <S%H437><s%> of Bashan, <S%H1316><s%> For the impenetrable <S%H1219><s%> forest <S%H9194><s%> has come <S%H3381><s%> down. <S%H3381><s%>

There is a sound <S%H6963><s%> of the shepherds' wail, <S%H3215><s%> For their glory <S%H155><s%> is ruined; <S%H7703><s%> There is a sound <S%H6963><s%> of the young <S%H3715><s%> lions' roar, <S%H7581><s%> For the pride <S%H1347><s%> of the Jordan <S%H3383><s%> is ruined. <S%H7703><s%>
Thus <S%H3541><s%> says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> "Pasture <S%H7462><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> [doomed] to slaughter. <S%H2028><s%>

"Those who <S%H834><s%> buy <S%H7069><s%> them slay <S%H2026><s%> them and go <S%H816><s%> unpunished, <S%H3808><s%> <S%H816><s%> and [each of] those who sell <S%H4376><s%> them says, <S%H559><s%> 'Blessed <S%H1288><s%> be the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> for I have become <S%H6238><s%> rich! <S%H6238><s%>' And their own shepherds <S%H7462><s%> have <S%H2550><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> pity <S%H2550><s%> on them.

"For I shall no <S%H3808><s%> longer <S%H5750><s%> have <S%H2550><s%> pity <S%H2550><s%> on the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%>" declares <S%H5002><s%> the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> "but behold, <S%H2009><s%> I shall cause the men <S%H120><s%> to fall, <S%H4672><s%> each <S%H376><s%> into another's power <S%H3027><s%> and into the power <S%H3027><s%> of his king; <S%H4428><s%> and they will strike <S%H3807><s%> the land, <S%H776><s%> and I shall not deliver <S%H5337><s%> [them] from their power. <S%H3027><s%>"

So I pastured <S%H7462><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> [doomed] to slaughter, <S%H2028><s%> hence <S%H3651><s%> the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> of the flock. <S%H6629><s%> And I took <S%H3947><s%> for myself two <S%H8147><s%> staffs: <S%H4731><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> I called <S%H7121><s%> Favor, <S%H5278><s%> and the other <S%H259><s%> I called <S%H7121><s%> Union; <S%H9115><s%> so I pastured <S%H7462><s%> the flock. <S%H6629><s%>

Then I annihilated <S%H3582><s%> the three <S%H7969><s%> shepherds <S%H7462><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> month, <S%H3391><s%> for my soul <S%H5315><s%> was impatient <S%H9527><s%> with them, and their soul <S%H5315><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> was weary <S%H973><s%> of me.

Then I said, <S%H559><s%> "I will not pasture <S%H7462><s%> you. What is to die, <S%H4191><s%> let it die, <S%H4191><s%> and what is to be annihilated, <S%H3582><s%> let it be annihilated; <S%H3582><s%> and let those who are left <S%H7604><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> one <S%H802><s%> another's flesh. <S%H1320><s%>"

And I took <S%H3947><s%> my staff, <S%H4731><s%> Favor, <S%H5278><s%> and cut <S%H1438><s%> it in pieces, <S%H1438><s%> to break <S%H6565><s%> my covenant <S%H1285><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I had made <S%H3772><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> the peoples. <S%H5971><s%>

So it was broken <S%H6565><s%> on that day, <S%H3117><s%> and thus <S%H3651><s%> the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> of the flock <S%H6629><s%> who were watching <S%H8104><s%> me realized <S%H3045><s%> that it was the word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

And I said <S%H559><s%> to them, "If <S%H518><s%> it is good <S%H2896><s%> in your sight, <S%H5869><s%> give <S%H3051><s%> [me] my wages; <S%H7939><s%> but if <S%H518><s%> not, never <S%H2308><s%> mind! <S%H2308><s%>" So they weighed <S%H8254><s%> out thirty <S%H7970><s%> [shekels] of silver <S%H3701><s%> as my wages.

Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, "Throw <S%H7993><s%> it to the potter, <S%H3335><s%> [that] magnificent <S%H145><s%> price <S%H3366><s%> at which <S%H834><s%> I was valued <S%H3365><s%> by them." So I took <S%H3947><s%> the thirty <S%H7970><s%> [shekels] of silver <S%H3701><s%> and threw <S%H7993><s%> them to the potter <S%H3335><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

Then I cut <S%H1438><s%> my second <S%H8145><s%> staff, <S%H4731><s%> Union, <S%H9115><s%> in pieces, <S%H1438><s%> to break <S%H6565><s%> the brotherhood <S%H264><s%> between <S%H996><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> and Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, "Take <S%H3947><s%> again <S%H5750><s%> for yourself the equipment <S%H3627><s%> of a foolish <S%H196><s%> shepherd. <S%H7462><s%>

"For behold, <S%H2009><s%> I am going to raise <S%H6965><s%> up a shepherd <S%H7462><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> who will not care <S%H6485><s%> for the perishing, <S%H3582><s%> seek <S%H1245><s%> the scattered, <S%H5289><s%> heal <S%H7495><s%> the broken, <S%H7665><s%> or sustain <S%H3557><s%> the one standing, <S%H5324><s%> but will devour <S%H398><s%> the flesh <S%H1320><s%> of the fat <S%H1277><s%> [sheep] and tear <S%H6561><s%> off <S%H6561><s%> their hoofs. <S%H6541><s%>

"Woe <S%H1945><s%> to the worthless <S%H457><s%> shepherd <S%H7473><s%> Who leaves <S%H5800><s%> the flock! <S%H6629><s%> A sword <S%H2719><s%> will be on his arm <S%H2220><s%> And on his right <S%H3225><s%> eye! <S%H5869><s%> His arm <S%H2220><s%> will be totally <S%H3001><s%> withered, <S%H3001><s%> And his right <S%H3225><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> will be blind. <S%H3543><s%>"
